summary: An email from a Drug Abuse Program Coordinator at the Federal Bureau of Prisons regarding suicide watch and psychological observation procedures for an inmate, sent on August 14, 2019. The document appears to be a standard procedural notification, likely related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration.

persons.name: PsyD Drug Abuse Program Coordinator
persons.context: Sender of the email outlining suicide watch and psychological observation procedures for an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center and Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Suicide Watch/Psych Observation Update Email
events.description: An email is sent from a Bureau of Prisons Drug Abuse Program Coordinator detailing procedures for initiating suicide watch and psychological observation for an inmate believed to be at risk for self-harm.

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated August 14, 2019, concerning suicide watch and psychological observation procedures for an inmate.
It instructs staff to maintain constant visual observation or initiate a formal Suicide Watch pending a risk assessment by a psychologist.
The email is sent from a Drug Abuse Program Coordinator within the Federal Bureau of Prisons.
It references two federal detention facilities in New York: the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn and the Metropolitan Correctional Center in Manhattan.
The timing (August 2019) coincides with Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death.
